title: [WIP] Implementation of IoTDB Function Runtime Interface.
body:
This pull request is work in progress.
## Description
This pull request is about implementation of function runtime interface, which is abstract of function runtime. It will be compatible with the UDFs previously implemented by Java , and can also support UDFs written in languages ​​such as JavaScript and Lua to run in runtimes of different languages.

title: [IOTDB-4432]Support drop timeseries semantic
body:
## Description
In this PR，I support drop timeseries, which is the same as delete timeseries.

title: [IOTDB-4547] Fix error in routing batch insert plannode
body:
When analysing batch insert statement, we will generate a List\<DataPartitionQueryParam\> to fetch partition. This list includes several devices and their time slots. The method PartitionFetcher.getDataPartition(List\<DataPartitionQueryParam\> dataPartitionQueryParams) can not process multiple DataPartitionQueryParams in a single device.

So when generating this list, we merge all DataPartitionQueryParams in a single device into one.

And this pr also adds some IT to test batch writing covering multiple time slots.

title: Accelerate restart proces
body: We found that when memory is limited and there are too many TsFileResources, during restart prcessing, there are too much time spent on deserializing devices from TsFile, because `ITimeIndex` degrade to `FileTimeIndex`. Dive into the restart process, we found that deserializing devices is for updating flush time of each device, so we can improve restarting by updating it before TsFileResource being added to `TsFileResourceManagement` when it can be degraded.

title: [IOTDB-4536] Add ClusterAlertingExample for trigger
Fix thrift access level
[To rel/0.13] Accelerate restart process
body: We found that when memory is limited and there are too many TsFileResources, during restart prcessing, there are too much time spent on deserializing devices from TsFile, because `ITimeIndex` degrade to `FileTimeIndex`. Dive into the restart process, we found that deserializing devices is for updating flush time of each device, so we can improve restarting by updating it before TsFileResource being added to `TsFileResourceManagement` when it can be degraded.

title: [IOTDB-4062] Add schema write check above consensus layer

## Description


### Motivation

Failing operation shall not persist in raft log.

### Modification

1. refactor region operation execution by setting up concentrate RegionReadExecutor and RegionWriteExecutor and both FragmentInstanceDispatcher and DataNodeInternalRpcService relying on it.
2. add measurement existence check before executing timeseries creation in consensus layer.

Please note that Aligned Timeseries has not been supported in Arithmetic Query yet. An error message is expected if you use Arithmetic Query with Aligned Timeseries selected.

[IOTDB-3656] mpp load change grammar
body:
origin load statement:
`load '<path/dir>' [autoregister=true/false][,sglevel=int][,verify=true/false]`
new load statement:
`load '<path/dir>' [sglevel=int] [verify=true/false] [onSuccess=delete/none]`

body: Create snapshot test in cluster integration-test for ConfigNode

title: [IOTDB-4465] Add interface for PatternTreeMap to optimize getOverlapped
body:
## Description

Add new interface:

```java
/**
 * Get a list of value lists related to PathPattern that overlapped with measurements under the
 * same device.
 *
 * @param devicePath device path without wildcard
 * @param measurements list of measurements
 * @return value list
 */
public List<List<V>> getOverlapped(PartialPath devicePath, List<String> measurements) ;
```

If there are N measurements under the same device, this interface can save N times to search device node.

title: Fix the issue that taking snapshot may stuck when waiting for flush
body:
## Description
Before this change, the snapshot taking may stuck because it didn't lock the DataRegion when invoking `syncCloseAllWorkingTsFileProcessors()`.

If the DataRegion is not `writeLock()`, subsequent writes will generate new unsealed TsFiles one by one, which will make the  `syncClose` operation won't be stopped.

title: [IOTDB-4423] Add TsFileMetricManager to take care of the tsfile status
body: See [IOTDB-4423](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-4423).

title: [IOTDB-4488] Implement ClusterSyncInfo snapshot by SyncLogWritter and SyncLogReader
body:
## Description

* Implement `ClusterSyncInfo` snapshot by SyncLogWritter and SyncLogReader. Add `ClusterSyncInfoTest`.
* Refactor SyncLogWritter and SyncLogReader. It migrates the serialization and deserialization logic to concrete objects. Decouples old standalone, new standalone and cluster. 
* Move SyncLogWritter and SyncLogReader to nodes-common for reuse.

title: [IOTDB-4541] Improve: cache latest snapshot info for ratis leader
body: Ratis Leader will query latest snapshot info every time it sends a AppendEntries. We should cache the latest snapshot and return directly, instead of query statemachine and scanning disk.

2. Add the logic for api `takeSnapshot` in MultiLeaderConsensus

title: add log & snapshot
ConfigNode snapshot integration test
body: Add ConfigNode snapshot test code. The ConfigNode will trigger snapshot if we getOrCreatePartition continuously.

title: [IOTDB-4529] Close active connections in prometheus reporter's disposable server when metric service stop.
body: Now, when metric service stop, we simply call `DisposableServer#disposeNow()` to close all inactive connections. After some search, I find setting channelGroup when create DisposableServer makes it possible to close active connections at the same time when call `DisposableServer#disposeNow()`. Related issues in reactor: 1. [Use the new Transport API for TCP/UDP/HTTP implementations](https://github.com/reactor/reactor-netty/pull/1046) 2. [Connections are not disposed when server is closed](https://github.com/reactor/reactor-netty/issues/495) 3. [HTTP client connection is not disposed on server side](https://github.com/reactor/reactor-netty/issues/581) Related Comments in code:

title: [IOTDB-4517] Fix cross_space and unseq_space compaction are slower at common timeseries and template timeseries
body:
See [IOTDB-4517](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-4517).

The fisrt reason is that the `currentChunkSize` does not reset when flushing chunk metadata to temp file in disk, leading to frequent flushing of chunk metadata.
The second reason is the concurrent issue caused by update to the start time and end time of tsfile resource in the compaction sub-task.

title: [IOTDB-4487] Remove enable_timed_close_tsfile in the time partition doc
[IOTDB-4495] Fix NPE when enable_auto_create_schema is false
body: See: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-4495

title: [IOTDB-4519] Fix existing measurement check during auto creating schema
body:
## Description


### Cause

The consensus layer only supports passing message by TSStatus when executing writing operation. The existing measurement info can only be passed by string format in TSStatus. The transformation between string and bytes won't work if the encoding method use double-byte charsets. 

### Solution

When transform measurementPath to String, use single-byte charsets.

title: fix ExecutableManager and complete createTrigger of ConfigNode
[IOTDB-4503] fix load error when autoregister is false
body:
problem:
- throw NPE when autoregister=false and enableAutoCreateSchema =false
- sill auto creating schema while autoregister=false
- file is deleted after load into local machine
- throw NPE when loading tsfile is not on local machine

solution:
- mandalically verify the metadata when registering metadata
- change `Files.createLink` to `Files.copy`
- return message to user to notice load function can only load local machine files.

title: Trigger test
[IOTDB-4520] The tag schema region is implemented and supports the influxdb protocol
body:
## Description
The current influxdb adapter uses iotdb to store the order of tags in order to generate a unique path for the combination of tags with the same semantics during implementation. In this way, in the implementation, it is necessary to first access iotdb to obtain the order of tags, and then convert the tags into paths and generate PhysicalPlan, which results in poor performance and is more complicated to implement a tag model adapter. This work enables the influxdb adapter to support the use of native tag model metadata management modules.
## New features
- lsm framework memory structure implementation：see https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcncdQ0sejMEEVqC1gIM9CKef#doxcni0oA80sqYOqeoEwp5kHun4
- tag inverted index：see https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcnlNVJnjaAMo0xVSpMsOAIVe
- tag schema region： see https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcn65XjYe64t8QyGiyLN2Ig0c
- influxdb adapter supports tag schema region：see https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcnZzEZ1BwXS6EQfrUEuGOX4d#doxcnKsqAa24qOwya4Oi1qdtFib

Temporal files for chunk metadata should be deleted in `TsFileIOWriter::endFile`.

title: [MultiLeader] Fix the issue that the wal won't be deleted when leader transfer to follower
body:
## Description
In MultiLeader consensus, if a leader transfer to follower, the wal files may won't be deleted due to the reason that `SafeIndex` is not set to the latest one.

In this PR, we change two places to solve this issue:
1. update the `SafeIndex` to the latest one to WALReader rather than keep it the same as the persistence value in IndexController
2. When finding an entry which is already deleted in WAL files, the WALReader will return the minimum one whose searchIndex is larger than the target entry

## Test
The following cases are tested locally:
1. Manually set the syncIndex to 47000 while the minimum index in WAL files is 47272. [Passed]
2. Manually set the syncIndex to 47000 while the WAL folder contains no entry. [Passed]
    * It will roll WAL file at most 1 time and continue to sync log once new write arrives.
3. Change leader to follower and test whether the wal files could be deleted [Passed]

title: [IOTDB-4378] Negtive feedback Region extension policy
body:
In order to make the Partition algorithm more durable, the following changes are made:

1. It's necessary to  create a new RegionGroup when no RegionGroups are available for a StorageGroup (all RegionGroups are Disabled). See the [RegionGroup Allocation](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccnHuDkDD6RiwLjaej3hkA9Vb#7zcC9L) doc for more details.
2. It's feasible for using Unknown DataNode to alllocate new Region when the number of Running DataNodes is insufficient. The RegionMaintainer thread will retry the Region creation process after the specified DataNodes are restarted. The RegionMaintainer thread was finished in [IOTDB-4370](https://github.com/apache/iotdb/pull/7306).
3. No matter whether the new RegionGroups creation is success or not, it takes no effects on the Partition allocation decision. Because we can only consider all available RegionGroups to process Partition allocation in this step. 

You can see the [Partition Algorithm](https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docs/doccn4uuWF6ZSmSkQcLPp57toBb#nnCJFO) doc to get an overview of the whole process.

title: [IOTDB-4392] build separate cache queue for MultiLeader log sync
body:
## Description
Before this change, the `CacheQueue` is shared in follower side because we thought there is only one sender at the same time. 
Let's say we have 3 peers named A、B、C. From our test, we found that sometimes the leader may changed occasionally between A and B. And C's cache queue may be shared by the requests from both A and B, which will led to out-of-order data with large time range overlap.

We use separate cache queue to solve this issue.

**Write Speed Test:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18027703/191670399-50f9c5cf-4491-4286-9fdb-3bfc49fb979a.png)

title: [IOTDB-3862] Fix: Guarantee to add Ratis MetaFile
body: When we let statemachine decide which files are included in a snapshot, statemachine won't include ratis meta files. We should check it manually and guarantee the metafile be added last.

title: [IOTDB-4456][IOTDB-4459] Sync cluster framework in ConfigNode and PipeSink operation
body:
## Description

### Sync Framework in Cluster Version

* This PR build code framework in confignode for cluster sync. Mainly about `SyncManager`, `ClusterSyncInfo` and some RPC interface. See https://apache-iotdb.feishu.cn/docx/doxcnpfFAOfJJGj6qmDM4VPEDNf for more details.
* I move some common data structure to nodes-common modules. For example, `PipeSink`, `PipeInfo`and so on. 
* `ClusterSyncInfo` and `LocalSyncInfo` are both persistent infomation about sync metadata. In standalone version, we need to write log for persistence manually. In cluster version, raft log will be responsible for persistence. There is no need to use `SyncLogWritter` for each operations in `ClusterSyncInfo`. Therefore, I extract the common data structure `SyncMetadata` to nodes-common and `ClusterSyncInfo` and `LocalSyncInfo` both have `SyncMetadata` object.

### PipeSink Operation

* I implement PipeSink operation as example. Now support:
  * CREATE PIPESINK
  * DROP PIPESINK
  * SHOW PIPESINK
  * SHOW PIPESINKTYPE
* Tested in `IoTDBPipeSinkIT`, which is implemented in the new IT framework. It will test both standalone version and cluster version, ensuring that response from the server is same.
